document.topic_text: Jeanette Burris Jeanette Christina MacDonald Burris of DeQueen, Ark. went to be with her Lord and Savior on Saturday, April 23, 2016 in Temple. She was born in Folkestone, Kent, England March 31, 1935 to Gladys Godden and Jerry MacDonald. She was raised by her mother and stepfather, Ernest Waller. She had four siblings, Gerald Godden, Janet Waller, Douglas Waller and Philip Waller. She met her husband, Norman L. Burris, who was in the American Air Force in England and became Jeanette C. Burris on September 22, 1956. Shortly after the birth of their first child, they moved back to the United States. They lived in Missouri for awhile and moved to several states. Most years were spent in Pasadena, Dickinson, El Campo and currently DeQueen, Ark. They raised six children, have 11 grandchildren and 12 great-grandchildren. Jeanette has been a devoted sister, wife, mother, grandmother and great-grandmother over the years. She and Norman would have been married 60 years on Sept. 22, 2016 but have been together for 62 plus years. She is survived by her husband of 59 years, Norman L. Burris of DeQueen, Ark; son, Steven Burris and wife Ginger of Santa Fe; daughters, Cheryl Anzaldua of New Caney, Teresa Hare and husband Terry of DeQueen, Ark., Tina Burris of Eagle Lake, Virginia Petersen and husband Roger of Pearland and Julie Tupa and husband Sammy of El Campo; brother, Philip Waller of Folkestone, Kent, England; sister, Janet Waymark of Lynsted Close, England; grandchildren, James Burris, Greg Burris, Amanda Lopez, George Lopez (Cintia), Christopher Lopez, Amber Hare Ramirez (Armando), Michael Hare (Lindsay), Jeremiah Burris, Tanner Albrecht, Joshua Petersen, Emily Tupa; great grandchildren Hunter Burris, Juan Briones, Breanna Briones, Joseph Briones, Micaela Briones, Christian Lopez, Azrael Lopez, Nehemiah Lopez, Benjamin Ramirez, Alexander Ramirez, Emma Ramirez and Alexia Ramirez. kAm$96 H2D AC646565 :? 562E9 3J 96C >@E96C[ DE6A72E96C[ 3C@E96CD[ s@F8=2D (2==6C 2?5 v6C2=5 v@556?j 8C62E\8C2?552F89E6C[ {:=29 #2>:C6K 2?5 D@?\:?\=2H[ uC65 p?K2=5F2 yC]k^Am kAm':D:E2E:@? 3682? 2E a A]>] |@?52J pAC:= ad 2E %C:D<2 uF?6C2= w@>6 H:E9 E96 72>:=J C646:G:?8 7C:6?5D 7C@> d\f A]>] uF?6C2= D6CG:46 H2D 96=5 2E ` A]>] %F6D52J[ pAC:= ae 2E q:3=6 %CFE9 pA@DE@=:4 r9FC49] x?E6C>6?E 7@==@H65 2E v2C56? @7 |6>@C:6D r6>6E6CJ]k^Am kAm!2==362C6CD 2C6 y2>6D qFCC:D[ vC68 qFCC:D[ v6@C86 {@A6K[ r9C:DE@A96C {@A6K[ |:4926= w2C6[ %2??6C p=3C649E[ #@86C !6E6CD6? 2?5 pC>2?5@ #2>:C6K]k^Am kAm|6>@C:6D 2?5 4@?5@=6?46D >2J 36 =67E 7@C E96 72>:=J 2Ei k6>mk2 9C67lQ9EEAi^^HHH]EC:D<27F?6C2=9@>6]4@>QmHHH]EC:D<27F?6C2=9@>6]4@>k^2mk^6>mk^Am kAmpCC2?86>6?ED 2C6 F?56C E96 5:C64E:@? @7 %C:D<2 uF?6C2= w@>6[ t= r2>A@]k^Am
